thread.title: Cabbie has lucky escape after taxi crashes into pub | Granada
thread.title_full: Cabbie has lucky escape after taxi crashes into pub | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Cabbie has lucky escape after taxi crashes into pub | Granada
text:
A taxi driver escaped with minor injuries after his black cab ploughed into the side of a pub.
Customers and staff were evacuated from The White Hart pub, on Heywood Old Road in Birch, Rochdale, after the accident.
It left a gaping hole in the building and damaged a window near the bar area.
Fire teams at the scene of the crash Credit: MEN Cab driver Arshad Hussain from Rochdale said he was forced to swerve into the building when another driver failed to stop at a junction as he approached.
The crash left a gaping hole in the pub Credit: MEN The 45-year-old escaped the accident with only cuts and bruises, with witnesses claiming he was lucky to be alive.
He said: “I am OK. I was driving from that side of the road. Another lady driver didn’t stop at the junction.
“I tried to swerve and not hit her and ended up in the wall. I am a bit disorientated at the moment.
“I have been driving since 2003 with black cabs. I would like to believe I am an experienced driver, it was just out of the blue.”
Neighbours said a number of collisions have happened at the junction and have campaigned for traffic lights to be installed.
Last updated Wed 7 Oct 2015 Travel Rochdale Greater Manchester
